clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Different Levels of Sedation With Local Anesthesia on Outcomes of Patients Received Hip Replacement Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Different Levels of Sedation With Lumbar and Sacral Plexus Block and on Outcomes of Patients Received Hip Replacement Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: With blocks of lumbar and lumbar plexus, we can reduce the intravenous anesthetics usage. To offer an satisfied surgery process for patients, a proper sedation is necessary. So in this study, we want to investigate the influence of different levels of sedation on outcomes of patients received hip replacement surgery . And try to find out a suitable level of sedation level.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

arm_group.description: Patients received Total intravenous anesthesia without local anesthesia, and the level of sedation will be maintained at 40-60 (bispect ral index) with sufentanil (0.5-1μg/kg)and propofol (Τarget controlled infusion:2.0-3.0μg/ml).

Patients received intravenous anesthesia and local anesthesia, and the level of sedation will be maintained at 60-80 (bispect ral index) with sufentanil (0-0.2μg/kg)and propofol (Τarget controlled infusion:1.0-1.5μg/ml).

Patients received intravenous anesthesia and local anesthesia, and the level of sedation will be maintained at 40-60 (bispect ral index) with sufentanil (0-0.2μg/kg)and propofol (Τarget controlled infusion:2.0-3.0μg/ml).

intervention.description: The different sedation levels of patients were achieved by different effective concentrations of propofol.
The doses of were different in 3 arms to satisfy the required to ease pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65 years or older and undergoing hip fracture repair
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe cognitive impairment (MMSE score, <15)
- Preoperative delirium as determined by Confusion Assessment Method
- Contraindications to local anesthesia
- Prior hip surgery
- Mental or language barriers that would preclude data collection
- Severe congestive heart failure (NewYork Heart Association class IV)
- Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease guidelines, stage III-IV)
